get.summary: Look up Action Definitions in the system
get.description: Performing a GET /api/actiondefinitions call will query for available Actions defined in the system. This includes the data needed to populate an Action in the system.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number from which data needs to be displayed (0-based)

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Expected number of entries per page

parameters.name: scheduleEnabled
parameters.description: Filtering action definitions by the availability of being scheduled

200.description: List of ActionDefinitions in the system

examples.application/xml:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<ops:action-definitions xmlns:ops="http://webservice.vmware.com/vRealizeOpsMgr/1.0/" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
    <ops:pageInfo totalCount="2">
        <ops:page>0</ops:page>
        <ops:pageSize>10</ops:pageSize>
    </ops:pageInfo>
    <ops:links>
        <ops:link href="/suite-api/api/actiondefinitions?page=0&pageSize=10" rel="SELF" name="current">
            <ops:description>self</ops:description>
        </ops:link>
        <ops:link href="/suite-api/api/actiondefinitions?page=0&pageSize=10" rel="RELATED" name="first">
            <ops:description>first</ops:description>
        </ops:link>
        <ops:link href="/suite-api/api/actiondefinitions?page=0&pageSize=10" rel="RELATED" name="last">
            <ops:description>last</ops:description>
        </ops:link>
    </ops:links>
    <ops:action-definition id="VMWARE-Power Off VM" type="UPDATE" canRecommend="true">
        <ops:displayName>Power Off VM</ops:displayName>
        <ops:actionAdapterKindKey>VMWARE</ops:actionAdapterKindKey>
        <ops:contextAdapterKindKey>VMWARE</ops:contextAdapterKindKey>
        <ops:contextResourceKindKey>VirtualMachine</ops:contextResourceKindKey>
        <ops:contextIds>PowerOffVM</ops:contextIds>
        <ops:scheduleEnabled>true</ops:scheduleEnabled>
    </ops:action-definition>
    <ops:action-definition id="VMWARE-Power On VM" type="UPDATE" canRecommend="true">
        <ops:displayName>Power On VM</ops:displayName>
        <ops:actionAdapterKindKey>VMWARE</ops:actionAdapterKindKey>
        <ops:contextAdapterKindKey>VMWARE</ops:contextAdapterKindKey>
        <ops:contextResourceKindKey>VirtualMachine</ops:contextResourceKindKey>
        <ops:contextIds>PowerOnVM</ops:contextIds>
        <ops:scheduleEnabled>true</ops:scheduleEnabled>
    </ops:action-definition>
</ops:action-definitions>

post.summary: Perform an Action on one or more resources
post.description: Performing a POST /api/actions/{id} will attempt to trigger the action with specified id. It is considered a best practice to use the actionExecution field from the POST /api/action/{id}/query that has been previously executed to populate the body of the request. Please note that additional values may be required in order to make the populateAction response body valid.

parameters.name: actionExecution
parameters.description: Describe instance data about performing an action.

x-examples.application/xml:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<ops:action-execution contextId="PowerOffVM" xmlns:ops="http://webservice.vmware.com/vRealizeOpsMgr/1.0/" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
    <ops:contextResourceId>7e780215-da07-4da1-9167-cd6892dcfdd8</ops:contextResourceId>
    <ops:parameterGroup resourceId="7e780215-da07-4da1-9167-cd6892dcfdd8"/>
</ops:action-execution>

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id for the action to be executed (can be retrieved via: GET /api/actiondefinitions)

200.description: List of Task Ids for the action run.

examples.application/xml:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<ops:str-values xmlns:ops="http://webservice.vmware.com/vRealizeOpsMgr/1.0/" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
    <ops:values>48f06ab4-c678-421f-a5df-8af66211a106</ops:values>
</ops:str-values>

post.summary: Populate the information needed to run an action
post.description:
Performing a POST /api/actions/{id}/query would yield a response object that includes the resources that the action would apply to with the populated values of each action context field for the resource. The response contains information about the parameters to the action's method. It also includes a sample input that would be used for running the action with POST /api/actions/{id} if you chose to run it on all applicable resources and not change the default input values.

The json result inside actionExecution can be used directly as input perform the action. In the xml result, the xml element ops:action-execution will need namespace binding added to it in order to use it in the request. xmlns:ops="http://webservice.vmware.com/vRealizeOpsMgr/1.0/"

parameters.name: actionPopulation
parameters.description: The additional information needed to populate the action.

x-examples.application/xml:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<ops:action-population xmlns:ops="http://webservice.vmware.com/vRealizeOpsMgr/1.0/" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
    <ops:contextResourceId>c5af764a-d4d5-4258-829c-8acb0604e4c7</ops:contextResourceId>
</ops:action-population>

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The Id for the action to be populate.

examples.application/xml:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<ops:populated-action id="VMWARE-Power Off VM" xmlns:ops="http://webservice.vmware.com/vRealizeOpsMgr/1.0/" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
    <ops:actionContext id="Power Off VM">
        <ops:fields>
            <ops:field id="Name" name="VM Name" component="textfield" input="false" displayOrder="0" hidden="false">
                <ops:expressionResults>
                    <ops:expressionResult>MyVMName</ops:expressionResult>
                </ops:expressionResults>
            </ops:field>
        </ops:fields>
    </ops:actionContext>
    <ops:methodParameters>
        <ops:methodParameter id="mOR" dataType="String" isRequired="true" isList="false"/>
    </ops:methodParameters>
    <ops:action-execution contextId="PowerOffVM">
        <ops:contextResourceId>7e780215-da07-4da1-9167-cd6892dcfdd8</ops:contextResourceId>
        <ops:parameterGroup resourceId="7e780215-da07-4da1-9167-cd6892dcfdd8"/>
    </ops:action-execution>
</ops:populated-action>

get.summary: Get Adapter Types
get.description: Get Adapter Types identified by the specified identifiers or all if 'null' is specified

parameters.name: adapterKindKey
parameters.description: Optional list of identifiers to filter by

parameters.name: retrieveResourceKindInfos
parameters.description: Optional param that specifies whether need to report resource-kind-keys

200.description: The Adapter Kinds defined within VMware Aria Operations

examples.application/xml:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>

        <ops:name>vCenter Adapter</ops:name>
        <ops:description>VMWare vCenter Adapter</ops:description>
        <ops:adapterKindType>GENERAL</ops:adapterKindType>
        <ops:describeVersion>100</ops:describeVersion>
    </ops:adapter-kind>

        <ops:name>vCenter Operations Adapter</ops:name>
        <ops:description>vC Ops Adapter for self-monitoring</ops:description>
        <ops:adapterKindType>GENERAL</ops:adapterKindType>
        <ops:describeVersion>101</ops:describeVersion>
    </ops:adapter-kind>

        <ops:name>HTTP Post</ops:name>

        <ops:adapterKindType>OPENAPI</ops:adapterKindType>
    </ops:adapter-kind>
</ops:adapter-kinds>

get.summary: Query for Resources within a particular Adapter Kind and Resource Kind
get.description: Optionally filter these resources based on resource name. The resource name (specified as a query parameter) will be used for doing a partial match. However, if the resource identifiers and their values are specified, name is ignored and the API enforces all the mandatory (both uniquely identifying and required) identifiers are specified. This allows for looking up a single resource using a ResourceKey and allows the translation between a ResourceKey and a Resource UUID. Example how to use the identifiers parameter (currently it cannot be used in our Swagger documentation): /api/adapterkinds/{adapterKindKey}/resourcekinds/{resourceKindKey}/resources?identifiers[key1]=value1&identifiers[key2]=value2

parameters.name: adapterKindKey
parameters.description: The Adapter Kind Identifier

parameters.name: identifiers
parameters.description: Key,value pairs representing the resource identifiers of a Resource

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The Resource Name (partial match)

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number from which data needs to be displayed (0-based)

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Expected number of entries per page

parameters.name: resourceKindKey
parameters.description: The Resource Kind Identifier

examples.application/xml: No Custom Example is Available

    <ops:resource-kind key="HostSystem">

examples.application/xml:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<ops:alert-definitions xmlns:ops="http://webservice.vmware.com/vRealizeOpsMgr/1.0/" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
    <ops:alert-definition>
        <ops:id>f080147f-c60d-4f08-8801-b602e2931b6f</ops:id>
        <ops:name>High CPU/Memory Usage</ops:name>
        <ops:description>CPU or MEM usage too High</ops:description>
        <ops:adapterKindKey>VMWARE</ops:adapterKindKey>
        <ops:resourceKindKey>HostSystem</ops:resourceKindKey>
        <ops:waitCycles>3</ops:waitCycles>
        <ops:cancelCycles>2</ops:cancelCycles>
        <ops:type>0</ops:type>
        <ops:subType>0</ops:subType>
        <ops:states>
            <ops:state severity="WARNING">
                <ops:composite-symptom-set>
                    <ops:operator>AND</ops:operator>
                    <ops:symptom-sets>
                        <ops:symptom-set>
                            <ops:symptomDefinitionIds>
                                <ops:symptomDefinitionId>Symptom5</ops:symptomDefinitionId>
                                <ops:symptomDefinitionId>!Symptom6</ops:symptomDefinitionId>
                            </ops:symptomDefinitionIds>
                            <ops:alertConditions>
                                <ops:alertCondition>
                                    <ops:waitCycles>5</ops:waitCycles>
                                    <ops:cancelCycles>5</ops:cancelCycles>
                                    <ops:severity>CRITICAL</ops:severity>
                                    <ops:condition xsi:type="ops:htCondition">
                                        <ops:key>cpu|demandmhz</ops:key>
                                        <ops:operator>GT_EQ</ops:operator>
                                        <ops:valueType>NUMERIC</ops:valueType>
                                        <ops:instanced>false</ops:instanced>
                                        <ops:targetKey>cpu|availablemhz</ops:targetKey>
                                        <ops:thresholdType>STATKEY</ops:thresholdType>
                                    </ops:condition>
                                </ops:alertCondition>
                            </ops:alertConditions>
                            <ops:relation>DESCENDANT</ops:relation>
                            <ops:adapterKindKey>VMWARE</ops:adapterKindKey>
                            <ops:resourceKindKey>Datastore</ops:resourceKindKey>
                            <ops:aggregation>ALL</ops:aggregation>
                            <ops:symptomSetOperator>AND</ops:symptomSetOperator>
                        </ops:symptom-set>
                        <ops:symptom-set>
                            <ops:symptomDefinitionIds>
                                <ops:symptomDefinitionId>Symptom100</ops:symptomDefinitionId>
                                <ops:symptomDefinitionId>Symptom101</ops:symptomDefinitionId>
                            </ops:symptomDefinitionIds>
                            <ops:relation>SELF</ops:relation>
                            <ops:aggregation>ALL</ops:aggregation>
                            <ops:symptomSetOperator>OR</ops:symptomSetOperator>
                        </ops:symptom-set>
                    </ops:symptom-sets>
                </ops:composite-symptom-set>
                <ops:impact>
                    <ops:impactType>BADGE</ops:impactType>
                    <ops:detail>health</ops:detail>
                </ops:impact>
            </ops:state>
        </ops:states>
        <ops:forVCDTenants>false</ops:forVCDTenants>
    </ops:alert-definition>
    <ops:alert-definition>
        <ops:id>AlertDefinition-147ff080-8801-c60d-4f08-931b6fb602e2</ops:id>
        <ops:name>MyAlertDefinition</ops:name>
        <ops:description>An Alert Definition associated with ESX host</ops:description>
        <ops:adapterKindKey>VMWARE</ops:adapterKindKey>
        <ops:resourceKindKey>HostSystem</ops:resourceKindKey>
        <ops:waitCycles>3</ops:waitCycles>
        <ops:cancelCycles>2</ops:cancelCycles>
        <ops:type>0</ops:type>
        <ops:subType>0</ops:subType>
        <ops:states>
            <ops:state severity="CRITICAL">
                <ops:symptom-set>
                    <ops:symptomDefinitionIds>
                        <ops:symptomDefinitionId>SymptomDefinition-5</ops:symptomDefinitionId>
                    </ops:symptomDefinitionIds>
                    <ops:relation>SELF</ops:relation>
                    <ops:aggregation>ALL</ops:aggregation>
                </ops:symptom-set>
                <ops:impact>
                    <ops:impactType>BADGE</ops:impactType>
                    <ops:detail>Health</ops:detail>
                </ops:impact>
            </ops:state>
        </ops:states>
        <ops:forVCDTenants>false</ops:forVCDTenants>
    </ops:alert-definition>
</ops:alert-definitions>

post.summary: Create a new Notification Plugin Instance
post.description: If the Notification plugin is a standard email plugin, then any untrusted certificates from the secure SMTP server is returned as part of the response, the api client should invoke a PATCH call to store these certificates. By default the notification plugin is in disabled state after being created. Use the modifyAlertPluginState API to enable the plugin.

parameters.description: The NotificationPlugin to create, including plugin type and configuration details

put.summary: Update an existing Notification Plugin Instance
put.description: Before updating a notification plugin, the plugin should be disabled. During the update process if there are any untrusted certificates returned by the server the patchAlertPlugin call should be made. Once the update is successfully completed, use modifyAlertPluginState API to enable the plugin.

parameters.name: instance
parameters.description: The NotificationPlugin to create, including plugin type and configuration details

delete.summary: Delete an existing Notification Plugin Instance
delete.description: The field checkDependencies is added to preserve the initial behavior. By default it is set to false. Case 1: When checkDependencies is false, the API has the following behavior: Dependent Notification Rules are cascade deleted. Dependent Report Schedules are unreferenced. Dependent Tenant Email Configurations are always checked. If any then deletion is failed. Case 2: When checkDependencies is true, the API has the following behavior: All dependencies are checked. If any then deletion is failed. To successfully delete the notification plugin, all conflicting dependencies must be removed.

parameters.name: checkDependencies
parameters.description: Flag to check plugin dependencies

parameters.name: pluginId
parameters.description: The identifier of the plugin instance

204.description: The notification plugin is deleted successfully

post.summary: Perform operations on one or more Alerts
post.description:
Modify multiple Alerts by looking them up using their identifiers and performing one of the following actions - Suspend, Cancel,Take Ownership, Release Ownership Examples:
POST /api/alerts?action=suspend&minutes=1
POST /api/alerts?action=cancel
POST /api/alerts?action=takeownership
POST /api/alerts?action=releaseownership
POST /api/alerts?action=assignownership

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: The action to take

parameters.name: alertIdList
parameters.description: Identifiers of the Alerts

x-examples.application/xml:

post.summary: Query for Alert groups using one or more criteria specified in the Query Spec
post.description: Example: POST /api/alerts/group/{groupingCondition}/query

parameters.name: adapterKind
parameters.description: Adapter kind to be used for grouping alerts by SCOPE

parameters.name: alertQuery
parameters.description: The alertQuery criteria

x-examples.application/xml:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<ops:alert-query compositeOperator="AND" xmlns:ops="http://webservice.vmware.com/vRealizeOpsMgr/1.0/" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
    <ops:alertId></ops:alertId>
    <ops:resource-query>
        <ops:name>Windows2017VM</ops:name>
        <ops:name>Windows2018VM</ops:name>
        <ops:regex>\\S+-BNA-\\S+</ops:regex>
        <ops:regex xsi:nil="true"/>
        <ops:adapterKind>VMWARE</ops:adapterKind>
        <ops:resourceKind>HostSystem</ops:resourceKind>
        <ops:resourceId>55328bb4-2c1c-43e4-a464-58ae92f1a51c</ops:resourceId>
        <ops:statKeyInclusive>true</ops:statKeyInclusive>
    </ops:resource-query>
    <ops:activeOnly>true</ops:activeOnly>
    <ops:alertCriticality>CRITICAL IMMEDIATE WARNING INFORMATION</ops:alertCriticality>
    <ops:alertStatus></ops:alertStatus>
    <ops:alertImpact></ops:alertImpact>
    <ops:alertControlState></ops:alertControlState>
    <ops:startTimeRange>
        <ops:startTime>1740454576</ops:startTime>
        <ops:endTime>1740464576</ops:endTime>
    </ops:startTimeRange>
    <ops:includeChildrenResources>true</ops:includeChildrenResources>
    <ops:extractOwnerName>false</ops:extractOwnerName>
</ops:alert-query>

parameters.name: groupingCondition
parameters.description: The condition to be used for grouping

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number from which data needs to be displayed (0-based)

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Expected number of entries per page

parameters.name: resourceKind
parameters.description: Resource kind to be used for grouping alerts by SCOPE

parameters.name: resourceNameFilter
parameters.description: Filter based on alert resource name (Used only in SCOPE flow)

200.description: AlertGroups of alerts matching the specified Query Spec and grouped using specified grouping-condition(Collection can be empty)

examples.application/xml:

get.summary: Get all the Alert Types and Subtypes defined in the system.
get.description:
Examples:
GET /api/alerts/types returns the Problem Alerts specific Alert Types & Subtypes
GET /api/alerts/types?ignoreLegacy=false returns all the Alert Types & Subtypes

parameters.name: ignoreLegacy
parameters.description: Setting to true will filter out the legacy Alert Types & Subtypes Defaults to true

200.description: All the Alert Types and the associated Subtypes

examples.application/xml: No Custom Example is Available

500.description: Error occurred while retrieving the Alert Types & Subtypes

get.summary: Look up an Alert by its identifier

parameters.description: UUID of the alert

200.description: The Alert for the specified identifier

    <ops:alertLevel>NONE</ops:alertLevel>
    <ops:startTimeUTC>1740454576</ops:startTimeUTC>
    <ops:cancelTimeUTC>0</ops:cancelTimeUTC>
    <ops:updateTimeUTC>1740464576</ops:updateTimeUTC>
    <ops:suspendUntilTimeUTC>0</ops:suspendUntilTimeUTC>
</ops:alert>

404.description: No Alert with the specified identifier is found

500.description: Error occurred while retrieving the Alert with the specified identifier

post.summary: Install agent on resource
post.description: Install app monitoring agent on specified resource. vCenters mapping should be present for this API to work. Correct configuration for vCenters mapping - vCenter is mapped to individual CP or CP part of non HA collector group. vCenter is mapped to HA enabled collector group. vCenters mapping APIs - Create vCenters mappings API POST /api/applications/vccpmappings. Delete vCenters mapping API DELETE /api/applications/vccpmappings.

parameters.name: resourceCredentials
parameters.description: Credentials of resources required to install the agent

x-examples.application/xml:

put.summary: Subscribe to Application Monitoring by downloading bootstrap bundle containing all required scripts for bootstraping ARC Agent from Endpoints
put.description:
Bootstrap Bundle primarily contains client certificates, Grains File containing configuration of
ARC Agent Components (ucp-minion, salt-minion, Telegraf) and seeder script.
This API also preseeds salt minion keys in ARC.
In SAAS, it also creates adapter if adapter does not exist.

parameters.name: collectorIP_or_GroupNm
parameters.description: IP of the collector or collector group name

parameters.name: ostype
parameters.description: The OS type, e.g. Windows, Unix

parameters.name: vmIp
parameters.description: The IP of Virtual Machine or UUID of Endpoint

200.description: The bootstrap bundle binary zip file

put.summary: UnSubscribe to Application Monitoring by downloading bootstrap bundle containing all required scripts for Unbootstraping ARC Agent from Endpoints.
put.description:
Bootstrap Bundle primarily contains client certificates, Grains File containing configuration of
ARC Agent Components (ucp-minion, salt-minion, Telegraf) and seeder script.

parameters.name: cleanup
parameters.description: Flag that indicates whether to clean all traces of application monitoring agent from vrops and ARC or not

parameters.name: collectorIP_or_GroupNm
parameters.description: IP of the collector or collector group name

parameters.name: ostype
parameters.description: The OS type, e.g. Windows, Unix

parameters.name: vmIp
parameters.description: The IP of Virtual Machine

200.description: The bootstrap bundle binary zip file

get.summary: Get all the available authentication sources in the system
get.description: Get all the available authentication sources in the system. NOTE: This API works both for authenticated and un-authenticated access. In case of authenticated access (by providing the Authorization header) it will return more information including auth source properties. Please also note that while triggering the API through Swagger interface it will work in un-authenticated scenario (Swagger will not send the Authorization header).

post.summary: Add a new authentication source in the system
post.description: If the authentication source is of type LDAP or AD and if ssl is enabled, the response object will contain a list of certificates found matching with the provided host.If the authentication source is not of type LDAP or AD (or) if ssl is not enabled, then the authentication source is available for use as soon as the api call is successful.It is the duty of the caller to call the PATCH (/sources) api with the certificate details. Once the PATCH api call is successful, the authentication source is available for use.

parameters.name: authSource
parameters.description: Contains authSource's type and its properties

x-examples.application/xml:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<ops:auth-source created="1740454576827" lastModified="1740454576827" xmlns:ops="http://webservice.vmware.com/vRealizeOpsMgr/1.0/" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
    <ops:name>TEST</ops:name>
    <ops:sourceType id="ACTIVE_DIRECTORY">
        <ops:name>ACTIVE_DIRECTORY</ops:name>
        <ops:description>DESC</ops:description>
    </ops:sourceType>
    <ops:name-value name="display-name">Test_11</ops:name-value>
    <ops:name-value name="host">brlrootdc01.vmware.com</ops:name-value>
    <ops:name-value name="domain">vmware.com</ops:name-value>
    <ops:name-value name="host-auto-select">false</ops:name-value>
    <ops:name-value name="use-ssl">true</ops:name-value>
    <ops:name-value name="user-name">username@vmware.com</ops:name-value>
    <ops:name-value name="password">password</ops:name-value>
    <ops:name-value name="base-domain">dc=vmware,dc=com</ops:name-value>
    <ops:name-value name="common-name">userPrincipalName</ops:name-value>
    <ops:name-value name="port">636</ops:name-value>
    <ops:name-value name="group-search-criteria">(|(objectClass=group)(objectClass=groupOfNames))</ops:name-value>
    <ops:name-value name="member-attribute">member</ops:name-value>
    <ops:name-value name="user-search-criteria"></ops:name-value>
    <ops:name-value name="member-match-field"></ops:name-value>
    <ops:name-value name="ldap-context-attributes"></ops:name-value>
</ops:auth-source>

200.description: The Auth source is not created in the system and ssl certificate details are returned as response. The caller has to call the PATCH (/auth/sources) API with the certificate details.

put.summary: Update an authentication source in the system
put.description: If the host is an ldap host and if host/port is changed, then the response will contain a list of certificates found matching with the host. It is the duty of the caller to call the PATCH (/sources) api with the certificate details. Once the PATCH api call is successful, the authentication source is available for use.

parameters.name: authSource
parameters.description: AuthSource object that contains authSource's ID, type, its properties and list of certificate details if ssl is enabled

x-examples.application/xml:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<ops:auth-source created="1740454577698" lastModified="1740454577698" xmlns:ops="http://webservice.vmware.com/vRealizeOpsMgr/1.0/" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
    <ops:id>00000000-0000-000a-0000-000000000014</ops:id>
    <ops:name>TEST</ops:name>
    <ops:sourceType id="ACTIVE_DIRECTORY">
        <ops:name>ACTIVE_DIRECTORY</ops:name>
        <ops:description>DESC</ops:description>
    </ops:sourceType>
    <ops:name-value name="display-name">Test_11</ops:name-value>

post.summary: Search user-groups for an auth source
post.description: The auth source can be SSO/VIDM/LDAP/AD. For the LDAP/AD auth source, the request should contain the name of the group. For the SSO/VIDM auth source, request should contain the name of the group and the SSO/VIDM domain. User-group's name can contain wildcards. Maximum of 25 user-groups are returned for SSO auth source.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the auth source

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The query object for user group search Notes Examples for LDAP/SSO user groups

x-examples.application/xml:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>

    <ops:name>vcadmin*</ops:name>
</ops:usergroup-search-request>

200.description: User-groups matching the request query Notes Examples for LDAP/SSO user groups

</ops:usergroup-search-responses>

post.summary: Import users from the auth source
post.description: Auth source can be SSO/VIDM/LDAP/AD/VIDB. When a user is being re-imported, make sure to populate the "id" field of the user. NOTE: In the case of vIDB users, the import occurs based on the provided externalId. If other provided details are incorrect, they will be asynchronously updated with the correct values right after the import operation is completed.

parameters.description: The ID of the Auth source

parameters.name: userList

post.summary: Create a new local user group or import SSO/VIDM/LDAP/AD/VIDB user groups
post.description: If the authSourceId is specified(in the request), then the user group will be imported from the corresponding auth source (LDAP/AD/SSO/VIDM/VIDB).Note that the id of the user group has to be null. For LDAP/AD groups the distinguishedName should be provided in the name field. The value of displayName is used only while importing LDAP/AD groups, and if it is not provided then the value of name will be assigned to it. For SSO/VIDM groups the value of name is assigned to displayName. NOTE: Before importing please make sure that the group exists in the specified authSource by using the following API - /api/auth/sources/{id}/usergroups/search . Otherwise, if you try to import a non-existing group, a new one will be created with the specified authSourceId. NOTE: In the case of vIDB user group, the import occurs based on the provided externalId. If other provided details are incorrect, they will be asynchronously updated with the correct values right after the import operation is completed.

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: The group object to be created.

post.summary: Create a Chargeback Report Schedule to generate a Report for the specified Report Definition and Resource(s)
post.description: To specify the time zone add X-Ops-API-Timezone header with value of format e.g. Asia/Yerevan. All the schedules created using this API will be configured to use GMT time zone.

parameters.name: X-Ops-API-Timezone
parameters.description:
Custom HTTP header used by Ops API clients to specify Timezone information.
This Timezone value will be typically used for Report Generation.
Either an abbreviation such as "GMT", "PDT" can be specified,
or a full name such as "America/Los_Angeles". Other
formats and representations are not supported.

Allowed values for configFileType: TxtWidgetConfig (Text Widget Content), ReskndMetricConfig (Widget Metric Configuration), TopoWidgetConfig (Topology Widget Configuration) , SolutionConfig (Management Packs Configuration).
Note: any sub folders, visible via UI, should be skipped in the path.

post.summary: Import content for current user from uploaded file
post.description: The "Content-Type" of the request is multipart/form-data. If the force option is set to true, content will be overwritten. By default the flag is true. NOTE: If the content file contains integration accounts, then upon completion of the import process, it is recommended to check them. Some collectors or collector groups may have become unbound from the accounts they serve and should be reconnected. Additionally, you will need to re-accept all untrusted certificates manually. Finally ensure that all your adapter instances are started as some of these may not have been restarted automatically.

parameters.name: EncryptionPassword
parameters.description: Key for decrypting sensitive information

parameters.name: contentFile
parameters.description: Multipart file

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: True to force solution content overwrite

202.description: The import of content has been accepted

examples.application/xml:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<ops:content-import id="bb1f4c64-b1e9-4a3f-a051-790d926342d2" xmlns:ops="http://webservice.vmware.com/vRealizeOpsMgr/1.0/" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
    <ops:fileName>contentFile</ops:fileName>
    <ops:force>false</ops:force>
    <ops:links>
        <ops:link href="/suite-api/api/content/operations/import" rel="RELATED" name="ImportStatusCheckURL">
            <ops:description>Status of the last import operation</ops:description>
        </ops:link>
    </ops:links>
</ops:content-import>

get.summary: Get all Credential Kinds defined in the system
get.description: Gets all the Credential Kinds defined in the system.  Optionally filter by adapter kind keys.

parameters.name: adapterKind
parameters.description: Filter by Adapter Kind Key

examples.application/xml:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<ops:credential-kinds xmlns:ops="http://webservice.vmware.com/vRealizeOpsMgr/1.0/" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
    <ops:credential-kind id="PRINCIPALCREDENTIAL">
        <ops:name>Principal Credential</ops:name>
        <ops:adapterKindKey>VMWARE</ops:adapterKindKey>
        <ops:fields>
            <ops:field key="USER" valueType="STRING" required="false" enumerated="false"/>
            <ops:field key="PASSWORD" valueType="STRING" required="false" enumerated="false"/>
        </ops:fields>
    </ops:credential-kind>
    <ops:credential-kind id="PRINCIPALCREDENTIAL">
        <ops:name>Principal Credential</ops:name>
        <ops:adapterKindKey>InvSvcAdapter</ops:adapterKindKey>
        <ops:fields>
            <ops:field key="VCADMIN" valueType="STRING" required="false" enumerated="false"/>
            <ops:field key="VCADMINPASSWORD" valueType="STRING" required="false" enumerated="false"/>
        </ops:fields>
    </ops:credential-kind>
    <ops:credential-kind id="HTTP">
        <ops:name>Http Credential</ops:name>
        <ops:adapterKindKey>ExampleAdapter</ops:adapterKindKey>
        <ops:fields>
            <ops:field key="UserType" defaultValue="User" valueType="string" required="false" enumerated="true">
                <ops:enumeratedValues>
                    <ops:enumeratedValue>Admin</ops:enumeratedValue>
                    <ops:enumeratedValue>User</ops:enumeratedValue>
                    <ops:enumeratedValue>Anonymous</ops:enumeratedValue>
                </ops:enumeratedValues>
            </ops:field>
            <ops:field key="Password" valueType="STRING" required="false" enumerated="false"/>
        </ops:fields>
    </ops:credential-kind>
</ops:credential-kinds>

put.summary: Manages a specific run of Dynamic Threshold (DT) Computation in a VMware Aria Operations Cluster
put.description: Currently one can Start or Stop a DT Run. Sample URI: PUT /api/deployment/cluster/dt?action=start PUT /api/deployment/cluster/dt?action=stop

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: The type of action that one needs to perform - can be either "start" or "stop"

204.description: DT Calculation task was started or stopped successfully without any error

500.description: DT Calculation task was not started successfully and there were some errors

get.summary: Get all global setting values

200.description: The global setting keys and values

get.summary: Get global settings metadata
get.description: Find all the name-key mappings here: Action History - ACTION_RETENTION_IN_DAYS, Deleted Objects - DELETED_OBJECTS_RETENTION_IN_HOURS, Deletion Scheduling Interval - DELETION_SCHEDULING_INTERVAL_IN_HOURS, Object History - OBJECT_HISTORY_RETENTION_IN_DAYS, Generated Reports Retention - GENERATED_REPORTS_RETENTION_TIME_IN_MONTHS, Session Timeout - SESSION_TIMEOUT_IN_MINUTES, Symptoms/Alerts - CANCELLED_ALERTS_SYMPTOMS_RETENTION_TIME_IN_DAYS, Time Series Data Retention - TIME_SERIES_DATA_RETENTION_IN_MONTHS, Additional Time Series Retention - ROLLUP_TIME_SERIES_DATA_RETENTION_IN_MONTHS, Deleted Users - DELETED_USERS_RETENTION_IN_DAYS, External Event Based Active Symptoms - OUTDATED_EVENT_BASED_SYMPTOMS_CANCELING_ENABLED, External Event Based Active Symptoms - ACTIVE_EVENT_BASED_SYMPTOMS_RETENTION_TIME_IN_DAYS, Maintain Relationship History - OBJECT_RELATIONSHIP_HISTORY_ENABLED, Dynamic Threshold Calculation - DYNAMIC_THRESHOLDING_UPDATE_TIME_IN_MINUTES, Cost Calculation - COST_CALCULATION_TIME_IN_MINUTES, Deprecated from VMware Aria Operations 8.14: Customer Experience Improvement Program - TELEMETRY_ENABLED, Allow vCenter users to log in to individual vCenters from VMware Aria Operations - VC_USER_LOGIN_TO_INDIVIDUAL_VC_ALLOWED, Allow vCenter users to log into VMware Aria Operations from vCenter clients - VC_USER_LOGIN_FROM_VC_WEBUI_ALLOWED, Allow vCenter users to log in to all vCenters from VMware Aria Operations - VC_USER_LOGIN_TO_ALL_VC_ALLOWED, System access URL - BASE_URL, Automated Actions - AUTOMATED_ACTIONS_ENABLED, Enable Standard Certification Validation - ENABLE_CERTIFICATE_VALIDATION_STANDARD_WAY, Concurrent UI login sessions - ALLOW_CONCURRENT_LOGIN_SESSIONS, Allow non-imported vIDM user access - ALLOW_NON_IMPORTED_VIDM_USERS_ACCESS, Dynamic Threshold Calculation - DYNAMIC_THRESHOLDING_ENABLED, Cost Calculation - COST_CALCULATION_ENABLED, Deleted Objects - DELETED_OBJECTS_RETENTION_IN_HOURS_EXPANSION, Generated Reports Retention - GENERATED_REPORTS_RETENTION_ENABLED, Docker image default registry URL - DOCKER_IMAGE_REGISTRY_URL, Tag Based Pricing Metrics - PRICING_TAG_DETAILED_METRICS, Tag based Costing Metrics - COSTING_TAG_DETAILED_METRICS, Cluster Utilization Ceiling Factor - CLUSTER_UTILIZATION_ROUND_OFF, Generated Reports Retention - GENERATED_REPORTS_RETENTION_TIME_IN_DAYS, Threshold For Adapters Certificate Expiration Alert - CERTIFICATE_ALARM_DAYS, Show Cost Savings - SHOW_COST_SAVINGS_RECLAMATION_SETTING, Include Powered off VMs for Reclamation (flag) - RECLAIM_POWERED_OFF_VMS_ENABLED, Include Powered off VMs for Reclamation (days) - RECLAIM_POWERED_OFF_VMS_DAYS, Include Idle VMs for Reclamation - RECLAIM_IDLE_VMS_ENABLED, Minimum number of days that VM has been idle for - RECLAIM_IDLE_VMS_DAYS, Exclude VM provisioned in last - EXCLUDE_IDLE_VMS_PROVISIONED_IN_LAST_DAYS, VM Idleness Criteria (MHz) - IDLENESS_INDICATOR_THRESHOLD_MHZ, VM Idleness Criteria (%) - IDLENESS_INDICATOR_THRESHOLD_PERCENT, Include Snapshots for Reclamation (flag) - RECLAIM_SNAPSHOTS_ENABLED, Include Snapshots for Reclamation (days) - RECLAIM_SNAPSHOTS_DAYS, Include Orphaned Disks for Reclamation (flag) - RECLAIM_ORPHANED_DISKS_ENABLED, Include Orphaned Disks for Reclamation (days) - RECLAIM_ORPHANED_DISKS_DAYS, Orphaned Disks Collection Time - ORPHANED_VMDK_COLLECTION_TIME_IN_MINUTES, Near Real-Time Monitoring Data Retention - NEAR_REAL_TIME_OBJECT_HISTORY_RETENTION, Credential Ownership Enforcement - ACTIVATE_CREDENTIAL_OWNERSHIP.

get.summary: Get global setting value for the requested key

put.summary: Update global setting value for specified key
put.description: The deprecation info and all key-name mappings can be found in the /api/deployment/config/globalsettings/metadata API's description.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The global setting key

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The global setting value

201.description: The global setting value is updated

get.summary: Get the health of all Services
get.description:
The information returned includes the Health of the Service, uptime, when the service was started and etc.
Specifically the Health of the Service is 'OK', when the Service is running and responsive, otherwise it is 'Error'.

examples.application/xml:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<ops:services xmlns:ops="http://webservice.vmware.com/vRealizeOpsMgr/1.0/" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
    <ops:service name="ADMINUI" health="OK"/>
    <ops:service name="API" health="OK"/>
</ops:services>

503.description: Not all services are not Healthy

get.summary: Get information about a specific Service that is part of the VMware Aria Operations stack
get.description:
The information returned includes the Health of the Service, uptime, start time of the service and etc.
Specifically the Health of the Service is 'OK', when the Service is running and responsive, otherwise it is 'Error'.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the Service

examples.application/xml:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<ops:service name="ADMINUI" health="OK" xmlns:ops="http://webservice.vmware.com/vRealizeOpsMgr/1.0/" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"/>

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<ops:service name="ADMINUI" health="ERROR" xmlns:ops="http://webservice.vmware.com/vRealizeOpsMgr/1.0/" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"/>

get.summary: Get the status of the node
get.description: The status is ONLINE, if all the services are running and responsive, else status is OFFLINE.

parameters.name: services
parameters.description: Optional set of services to get the aggregated statuses of the node (with empty set the statuses of all services will be aggregated)

examples.application/xml:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<ops:node-status xmlns:ops="http://webservice.vmware.com/vRealizeOpsMgr/1.0/" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
    <ops:status>ONLINE</ops:status>
    <ops:systemTime>0</ops:systemTime>
</ops:node-status>

post.summary: Push a single Event into the system with associating an adapter kind as the event source
post.description: If the adapter kind specified is not present in the system, it will be created dynamically. However, if the adapter kind specified does already exist, then it must be of OPENAPI adapter kind type. Also the API sanitizes the Push Adapter Kind key by removing invalid characters (e.g.: Embedded HTML & JS)

parameters.name: adapterKind
parameters.description: The adapter kind key of the adapter source

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The event object

x-examples.application/xml:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>

</ops:event>

get.summary: Query for all maintenance schedules based on schedule id, schedule name and resource id
get.description: Using this method, you can get all maintenance schedules with or without specific parameters

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Maintenance schedule identifiers

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Maintenance schedule names or keys

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number from which data needs to be displayed (0-based)

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Expected number of entries per page

parameters.name: resourceId
parameters.description: List of Object identifiers

200.description: The Maintenance Schedules that match the criteria specified

examples.application/xml:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<ops:maintenance-schedules xmlns:ops="http://webservice.vmware.com/vRealizeOpsMgr/1.0/" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
    <ops:maintenance-schedule id="4be68401-4294-4a7b-ba55-5f8753b7b757" key="daily-ms1">
        <ops:schedule>
            <ops:hour>3</ops:hour>
            <ops:minuteOfTheHour>0</ops:minuteOfTheHour>
            <ops:duration>180</ops:duration>
            <ops:scheduleType>DAILY</ops:scheduleType>
            <ops:recurrence>1</ops:recurrence>
            <ops:expirationDate>01/20/2050</ops:expirationDate>
            <ops:timeZone>Asia/Yerevan</ops:timeZone>
        </ops:schedule>
    </ops:maintenance-schedule>
    <ops:maintenance-schedule id="26a8a7d3-0e3c-4fac-a5b4-4176b9ed1a44" key="monthly-ms1">
        <ops:schedule>
            <ops:hour>3</ops:hour>
            <ops:minuteOfTheHour>0</ops:minuteOfTheHour>
            <ops:duration>3</ops:duration>
            <ops:scheduleType>MONTHLY</ops:scheduleType>
            <ops:daysOfTheMonth>1 2</ops:daysOfTheMonth>
            <ops:months>1</ops:months>
            <ops:timeZone>Asia/Yerevan</ops:timeZone>
            <ops:expireRuns>3</ops:expireRuns>
        </ops:schedule>
    </ops:maintenance-schedule>
    <ops:maintenance-schedule id="57fe212b-8334-4c62-b31c-b6f3d6dc2a5b" key="weekly-ms1">
        <ops:schedule>
            <ops:hour>15</ops:hour>
            <ops:minuteOfTheHour>3</ops:minuteOfTheHour>
            <ops:duration>1</ops:duration>
            <ops:scheduleType>WEEKLY</ops:scheduleType>
            <ops:recurrence>5</ops:recurrence>
            <ops:daysOfTheWeek>SATURDAY SUNDAY</ops:daysOfTheWeek>
            <ops:timeZone>Asia/Yerevan</ops:timeZone>
            <ops:expireRuns>7</ops:expireRuns>
        </ops:schedule>
    </ops:maintenance-schedule>
</ops:maintenance-schedules>

examples.application/xml:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<ops:notification-templates xmlns:ops="http://webservice.vmware.com/vRealizeOpsMgr/1.0/" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
    <ops:notificationTemplates>
        <ops:notificationTemplate templateId="1e7ef275-65e3-4d95-a7f0-787e2ed05a07" templateType="ALERT">
            <ops:pluginTypeId>WebhookPlugin</ops:pluginTypeId>
            <ops:name>Template</ops:name>
            <ops:description>WebhookPlugin Description</ops:description>
            <ops:contentConfigs>
                <ops:contentConfig>
                    <ops:baseResourceKindKeyStats>
                        <ops:resourceKindKey>
                            <ops:resourceKind>Resource kind</ops:resourceKind>
                            <ops:adapterKind>Adapter kind</ops:adapterKind>
                        </ops:resourceKindKey>
                        <ops:stats>
                            <ops:stat>Property key</ops:stat>
                            <ops:stat>Stat key</ops:stat>
                        </ops:stats>
                    </ops:baseResourceKindKeyStats>
                    <ops:ancestorResourceKindKeys>
                        <ops:ancestorResourceKindKey>
                            <ops:resourceKindKey>
                                <ops:resourceKind>Ancestor Resource kind</ops:resourceKind>
                                <ops:adapterKind>Ancestor Adapter kind</ops:adapterKind>
                            </ops:resourceKindKey>
                            <ops:stats>
                                <ops:stat>Ancestor Stat Key</ops:stat>
                                <ops:stat>Ancestor Property Key</ops:stat>
                            </ops:stats>
                        </ops:ancestorResourceKindKey>
                    </ops:ancestorResourceKindKeys>
                    <ops:descendantResourceKindKeys>
                        <ops:descendantResourceKindKey>
                            <ops:resourceKindKey>
                                <ops:resourceKind>Descendant Resource kind</ops:resourceKind>
                                <ops:adapterKind>Descendant Adapter kind</ops:adapterKind>
                            </ops:resourceKindKey>
                            <ops:stats>
                                <ops:stat>Descendant Property Key</ops:stat>
                                <ops:stat>Descendant Stat Key</ops:stat>
                            </ops:stats>
                        </ops:descendantResourceKindKey>
                    </ops:descendantResourceKindKeys>
                </ops:contentConfig>
            </ops:contentConfigs>
            <ops:formattingTemplate xsi:type="ops:webhookTemplate">
                <ops:newAlertTemplate>
                    <ops:endpoint>/endpoint</ops:endpoint>
                    <ops:headers>
                        <ops:header>
                            <ops:key>Content-type</ops:key>
                            <ops:value>application/json</ops:value>
                        </ops:header>
                        <ops:header>
                            <ops:key>Header Key</ops:key>
                            <ops:value>Header Value</ops:value>
                        </ops:header>
                    </ops:headers>
                    <ops:method>POST</ops:method>
                    <ops:payload>{"startDate":"${CREATE_TIME}"}</ops:payload>
                </ops:newAlertTemplate>
            </ops:formattingTemplate>
        </ops:notificationTemplate>
    </ops:notificationTemplates>
</ops:notification-templates>

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<ops:workload-placement-settings xmlns:ops="http://webservice.vmware.com/vRealizeOpsMgr/1.0/" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
    <ops:taggingScope>CLUSTER_BASED</ops:taggingScope>
    <ops:tagGroups>
        <ops:tagGroup>
            <ops:name>Operating System</ops:name>
            <ops:prioritized>true</ops:prioritized>
            <ops:tags/>
            <ops:resourceTags>
                <ops:resourceTag category="tag_category_1" name="tag_name_1"/>
                <ops:resourceTag category="tag_category_1" name="tag_name_2"/>
            </ops:resourceTags>
        </ops:tagGroup>
        <ops:tagGroup>
            <ops:name>Network</ops:name>
            <ops:prioritized>false</ops:prioritized>
            <ops:tags/>
            <ops:resourceTags/>
        </ops:tagGroup>
    </ops:tagGroups>
    <ops:excludedClusterTagGroups>
        <ops:excludedClusterTagGroup>
            <ops:name>Operating System</ops:name>
            <ops:tags/>
            <ops:resourceTags>
                <ops:resourceTag category="tag_category_2" name="tag_name_1"/>
                <ops:resourceTag category="tag_category_2" name="tag_name_2"/>
            </ops:resourceTags>
        </ops:excludedClusterTagGroup>
    </ops:excludedClusterTagGroups>
    <ops:excludedVmTagGroups/>
    <ops:placementSettingsEnabled>true</ops:placementSettingsEnabled>
    <ops:clusterExclusionEnabled>false</ops:clusterExclusionEnabled>
    <ops:vmExclusionEnabled>false</ops:vmExclusionEnabled>
</ops:workload-placement-settings>

put.summary: Set up your business intent to place VMs based on criteria
put.description:
To set host level placement constraints, VMware Aria Operations will automatically create and manage DRS rules. All conflicting user-created DRS rules need to be DEACTIVATED. These include the following:
  • VM-VM affinity / anti-affinity
  • VM-Host affinity / anti-affinity

parameters.name: dataCenterId
parameters.description: Identifier of the dataCenter

parameters.name: deactivateDRSRules
parameters.description: During HOST_BASED configuration, set this flag to true to deactivate all conflicting user-created DRS rules

parameters.name: placementSettings
parameters.description: Placement settings object

post.summary: Create a Report Schedule to generate a Report for the specified Report Definition and Resource(s)
post.description: To specify the time zone add X-Ops-API-Timezone header with value of format e.g. Asia/Yerevan. All the schedules created using this API will be configured to use GMT time zone.

parameters.name: X-Ops-API-Timezone
parameters.description:
Custom HTTP header used by Ops API clients to specify Timezone information.
This Timezone value will be typically used for Report Generation.
Either an abbreviation such as "GMT", "PDT" can be specified,
or a full name such as "America/Los_Angeles". Other
formats and representations are not supported.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Report Definition identifier

parameters.name: reportSchedule
parameters.description: The Report Schedule to create in the system

x-examples.application/xml:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<ops:report-schedule reportDefinitionId="fad2f30f-5926-487b-ac8a-65818d179387" xmlns:ops="http://webservice.vmware.com/vRealizeOpsMgr/1.0/" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
    <ops:resourceId>5286a834-0938-44bc-83ad-a876b14f90d2</ops:resourceId>
    <ops:traversalSpec adapterInstanceAssociation="false">
        <ops:name>Traversal spec name</ops:name>
        <ops:rootAdapterKindKey>VMWARE</ops:rootAdapterKindKey>
        <ops:rootResourceKindKey>VM</ops:rootResourceKindKey>
    </ops:traversalSpec>

parameters.description: Array of CredentialIDs

None null value specifies to include related resource ids of given relationship type in resource result.
Uses the RelationshipType.representation value.

parameters.description:
Array of {@link UUID} that identify Maintenance Schedules.
Since vROps 6.1.0 release onwards, we don't support search
and look up of Resources using Maintenance Schedules' identifiers.

parameters.description: Array of resource names to query for. NOTE: Currently, only single element supported

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number from which data needs to be displayed (0-based)

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Expected number of entries per page

parameters.name: parentId
parameters.description: Array of UUID of object that are the parent resource in a parent child relationship

parameters.name: propertyName
parameters.description: Name of property. Query only supports filtering for a single property.

parameters.name: propertyValue
parameters.description: Value of property. Omitting the property value will check for existence of the property name on the resource. NOTE: Use 'propertyConditions' to specify lookup of Resource using multiple properties.

parameters.name: recentlyAdded
parameters.description: Return resources created after the specified value. Value is the number of seconds since Midnight January 1, 1970 GMT.

parameters.name: regex
parameters.description: Array of resource names in java regex format. NOTE: regex and name are mutually exclusive. If both are specified, name is given preference.

parameters.name: resourceHealth
parameters.description: Array of resource health

parameters.name: resourceId
parameters.description: Array of Resource Identifiers

parameters.name: resourceKind
parameters.description: Array of Resource Kind keys

parameters.name: resourceState
parameters.description: Array of resource states. NOTE, the following states are applicable only for adapter instances: STOPPED, STARTING, STOPPING, UPDATING, FAILED, REMOVING

parameters.name: resourceStatus
parameters.description: Array of resource data collection statuses. NOTE, the following statuses are applicable only for adapter instances: ERROR, DOWN, COLLECTOR_DOWN. The statuses OLD_DATA_RECEIVING, NO_PARENT_MONITORING and UNKNOWN are deprecated.

parameters.name: statKey
parameters.description: Name of resource StatKey to validate value is within a range. Use with statKeyLowerBound, statKeyUpperBound and statKeyInclusive to create comparison conditions NOTE: Use 'statConditions' to specify lookup of Resource using multiple stat keys.

parameters.name: statKeyInclusive
parameters.description: Filtering by statKey values is inclusive or exclusive of boundary values.  Defaults to true

parameters.name: statKeyLowerBound
parameters.description: StatKey value matching range lower bound

parameters.name: statKeyUpperBound
parameters.description: StatKey value matching range upper bound

200.description: The Collection of Resources matching the specified query parameters

put.summary: Update a Resource in the system
put.description:
Implementation Notes:

  • When updating a Resource, if the Resource Identifiers that are unique and required are not specified, the API would return an error with HTTP status code of 500 and an error message indicating the set of missing Resource Identifiers.
  • When updating a Resource, if the Resource Identifiers that are unique but not required are not specified, the Resource is updated where the uniquely identifying Resource Identifiers that were not specified will have their value as an empty string.

post.summary: Create a new Resource in the system associated with the specified adapter kind
post.description:
This adapter kind (referred to as 'Push' adapter kind) will be created if it does not exist in the system and an instance of it will be associated with the Resource being created. This adapter kind if it already exists must of OPENAPI adapter kind type. The API will also create the missing Adapter Kind and Resource Kind contained within the ResourceKey of the Resource if they do not exist.

Additional implementation notes:

  • When creating a Resource, if the Resource Identifiers that are unique and required are not specified, the API would return an error with HTTP status code of 500 and an error message indicating the set of missing Resource Identifiers.
  • When creating a Resource, if the Resource Identifiers that are unique but not required are not specified, the Resource is created where the uniquely identifying Resource Identifiers that were not specified will have their value as an empty string.

parameters.name: adapterKindKey
parameters.description: The adapter kind key

parameters.name: resourceRequest
parameters.description: The request object that contains info necessary to create a new resource

delete.summary: Delete custom datacenters
delete.description:
Delete custom datacenters.
NOTE: Deletion of custom datacenters is not synchronous. As a result,
the delete operation may not happen immediately. Furthermore, there is no way
to track the status of the deletion operation. It is recommended to query back
the system and ensure that the resources (datacenters) with given ids are not present any more.
NOTE: This API is only for custom datacenters deletion. Any invalid or none custom datacenter ids in the request body will be ignored.

parameters.description: Custom datacenter ids

put.summary: Put all the specified Resource in Maintenance
put.description:
The Resources can end up in two maintenance states - MAINTAINED OR MAINTAINED_MANUAL - depending upon the inputs specified.
  • If duration/end time is specified, the Resources will be placed in MAINTAINED state and after the duration/end time expires, the state of the Resources would be automatically set to the state they were in before entering the maintenance window.
  • If duration/end time is not specified, the Resources will be placed in MAINTAINED_MANUAL state. Callers have to execute DELETE /suite-api/api/resources/maintained?id=ID1&id=ID2 API to set the Resources back to whatever state they were in.
  • If both duration and end time are specified, end time takes preference over duration.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: The Duration for which this resource will be in maintenance (In Minutes)

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: The End time of the maintenance window as a long value (Epoch time)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The Resource identifiers

200.description: The resource is put in maintenance successfully

delete.summary: Bring the specified set of Resources out of Maintenance manually
delete.description: Bring the specified set of Resources out of Maintenance manually

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A collection of Resource identifiers

200.description: The resource is brought out from maintenance successfully

put.summary: Inform one or more or all Adapters to start monitoring a Collection of Resources. Note: Start isn't supported on per resource bases any more.
put.description: The query parameter id is for specifying the set of Resources that should be monitored. The optional query parameter adapterId determines which of the Adapters need to be informed to start monitoring the Resources. If this is not specified, then all of the Adapters will start monitoring the specified Resources.

parameters.name: adapterId
parameters.description: Collection of adapter instance identifiers that should start monitoring the Resources

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The Resource identifiers that need to be monitored

200.description: The resource monitoring is started successfully

put.summary: Inform one or more or all Adapters to stop monitoring a Collection of Resources. Note: Stop isn't supported on per resource bases any more.
put.description: The query parameter id is for specifying the set of Resources that should no longer be monitored. The optional query parameter adapterId determines which of the Adapters need to be informed to stop monitoring the Resources. If this is not specified, then all of the Adapters will stop monitoring the specified Resources.

parameters.name: adapterId
parameters.description: Collection of adapter instance identifiers that should stop monitoring the Resources

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The Resource identifiers that no longer need to be monitored

200.description: The resource monitoring is stopped successfully

get.summary: Get stats for one or more Resources using the specific query spec
get.description: This is a GET endpoint and the query parameters control the data that is retrieved. If the number of Resources for which one needs to query data is large, it is recommended to use the POST /api/stats/query endpoint to avoid the URL length limitations. Takes the form: api/resources/stats?resourceId=UUID1 OR api/resources/stats?resourceId=UUID2&statKey=cpu|usagemhz&rollUpType=&begin=&end=

parameters.name: begin
parameters.description:
The beginning date as a long value of the range of stats to return
Value measures the number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC
NOTE: If not provided, 24 hour rearward of ending date is used

parameters.name: currentOnly
parameters.description:
Indicates whether to report only "current" stat values, i.e. skip the stat-s that haven't published any value
during recent collection cycles.

parameters.name: dt
parameters.description:
Indicates that the requested stats are based on some dynamic threshold.
<b>Defaults to false which indicates that stats are not based on dynamic threshold.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description:
The ending date as a long value of the range of stats to return
Long value is number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC
NOTE: The ending date must not be less than the beginning date.
If not provided, current time as UTC milliseconds is used

parameters.name: intervalQuantifier
parameters.description: Number for the interval type

parameters.name: intervalType
parameters.description: Interval type requested by the user (e.g: Days, Weeks, Months etc.)

parameters.name: latestMaxSamples
parameters.description:
The maximum number of samples to return when querying latest.
When processing the get latest stats query if it is omitted a value of 1 is assumed.
A query for the latest samples is not compatible with specifying the RollUpType value.

parameters.name: metrics
parameters.description: Indicates whether specified statKey-s of query should be forcibly treated as metrics (does not include instanced stats)

parameters.name: resourceId
parameters.description: Array of Resource ids for which the stats should be fetched

parameters.name: rollUpType
parameters.description: Rollup Type requested by the user (e.g.: AVG, MIN, MAX etc.)

parameters.name: statKey
parameters.description: Array of stat keys for which the stats should be returned

parameters.name: wrapStatValues
parameters.description:
Indicates whether stat values should be wrapped for application/xml response content type.
This flag is false by default and not needed for application/json response.
If set to true "statValues" will be returned instead of "values" for all content types.

200.description: The object containing a map of list of stat objects keyed by each Resource identifier

examples.application/xml: No Custom Example is Available

        <ops:stat-list>
            <ops:stat>
                <ops:timestamps>1740454579803 1740454589803</ops:timestamps>
                <ops:statKey>
                    <ops:key>stat|key1</ops:key>
                </ops:statKey>
                <ops:rollUpType>NONE</ops:rollUpType>
                <ops:intervalUnit>
                    <ops:quantifier>5</ops:quantifier>

get.summary: Get the Top-N stats data for one or more Resources and a set of StatKeys
get.description: Get the Top-N stats data for one or more Resources and a set of StatKeys

parameters.name: begin
parameters.description:
The beginning date as a long value of the range of stats to return
Value measures the number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC
NOTE: If not provided, 24 hour rearward of ending date is used

parameters.name: currentOnly
parameters.description:
Indicates whether to report only "current" stat values, i.e. skip the stat-s that haven't published any value
during recent collection cycles.

parameters.name: dt
parameters.description:
Indicates that the requested stats are based on some dynamic threshold.
<b>Defaults to false which indicates that stats are not based on dynamic threshold.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description:
The ending date as a long value of the range of stats to return
Long value is number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC
NOTE: The ending date must not be less than the beginning date.
If not provided, current time as UTC milliseconds is used

parameters.name: groupBy
parameters.description: The type of grouping, if not set defaults to ResourceStatGroupBy.RESOURCE

parameters.name: intervalQuantifier
parameters.description: Number for the interval type

parameters.name: intervalType
parameters.description: Interval type requested by the user (e.g: Days, Weeks, Months etc.)

parameters.name: latestMaxSamples
parameters.description:
The maximum number of samples to return when querying latest.
When processing the get latest stats query if it is omitted a value of 1 is assumed.
A query for the latest samples is not compatible with specifying the RollUpType value.

parameters.name: metrics
parameters.description: Indicates whether specified statKey-s of query should be forcibly treated as metrics (does not include instanced stats)

parameters.name: resourceId
parameters.description: Array of Resource ids for which the stats should be fetched

parameters.name: rollUpType
parameters.description: Rollup Type requested by the user (e.g.: AVG, MIN, MAX etc.)

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: The type of sorting, if not set defaults to ResourceStatSort.ASCENDING

parameters.name: statKey
parameters.description: Array of stat keys for which the stats should be returned

parameters.name: topN
parameters.description:
The number of results. Keep in mind if a grouping contains multiple items (eg:
grouped by resource, with 4 metrics for the grouping resource) then returning the group with
4 metrics counts as 4 topN entries. If there are not enough remaining open topN entries to
return an entire group within the topN then the entire group is not returned. *

parameters.name: wrapStatValues
parameters.description:
Indicates whether stat values should be wrapped for application/xml response content type.
This flag is false by default and not needed for application/json response.
If set to true "statValues" will be returned instead of "values" for all content types.

200.description: TopN data keyed by each Resource identifier

put.summary: Put the specific Resource in Maintenance
put.description:
The Resource can end up in two maintenance states - MAINTAINED OR MAINTAINED_MANUAL - depending upon the inputs specified.
  • If duration/end time is specified, the resource will be placed in MAINTAINED state and after the duration/end time expires, the resource state is automatically set to the state it was in before entering the maintenance window.
  • If duration/end time is not specified, the resource will be placed in MAINTAINED_MANUAL state. Callers have to execute DELETE /suite-api/api/resources/{id}/maintained API to set the Resource back to whatever state it was in.
  • If both duration and end time are specified, end time takes preference over duration.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: Duration for which this resource will be in maintenance (In Minutes)

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: End time of the maintenance window as a long value (Epoch time)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The Resource identifier

200.description: The resource is put in maintenance successfully

delete.summary: Bring the Resource out of Maintenance manually
delete.description: Bring the Resource out of Maintenance manually

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The Resource identifier

200.description: The resource is brought out from maintenance successfully

put.summary: Inform one or more or all Adapters to stop monitoring this Resource. Note: Stop isn't supported on per resource bases any more.

It is recommended (though not required) to use this API when the resource was created using the API POST /api/resources/{id}/adapters/{adapterInstanceId}. Otherwise an additional adapter instance might be created. Note: Those properties that are specified with old timestamp will be published with current time. post.summary: Add relationships of given type to the resource with specified resourceId
post.description:
• If at least a few of the Resource that are part of relatedIds list are valid resources then the operation is performed.
  • If there are few Resource that are part of relatedIds list that will result in a cyclical relationship, then those resources will be skipped.

NOTE: Adding relationship is not synchronous. As a result, the add operation may not happen immediately. It is recommended to query the relationships of the specific Resource back to ensure that the operation was indeed successful.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The UUID of the source resource

parameters.name: relatedIds
parameters.description: UUID of resources to add as related to this resource

</ops:uuid-values>

parameters.name: relationshipType
parameters.description: The type of relationship of the objects; Uses the RelationshipType.representation value

204.description: The relationship is added successfully

404.description: All of the Resource that are part of the relatedIds list are invalid/non-existent

put.summary: Set (Replace) Resource as RelationshipType of a specific Resource
put.description:
This API exposes replace semantics. Therefore, all the existing relationships of the specified relationshipType will be removed and replaced with the resources specified as part of the request body.

  • If at least a few of the Resource that are part of relatedIds list are valid resources then the operation is performed.
  • If there are few Resource that are part of relatedIds list that will result in a cyclical relationship, then the operation is aborted.

NOTE: Setting relationship is not synchronous. As a result, the set operation may not happen immediately. It is recommended to query the relationships of the specific Resource back to ensure that the operation was indeed successful.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The UUID of the source resource

parameters.name: relatedIds
parameters.description: UUID of resources to set as related to this resource

get.description: NOTE: Unless a time range is explicitly set, the method returns statKeys which have received data in the last 24 hours.

parameters.name: begin
parameters.description:
The beginning date as a long value of the range of stats to return
Value measures the number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC
NOTE: If not provided, 24 hour rearward of ending date is used

parameters.name: currentOnly
parameters.description:
Indicates whether to report only "current" stat values, i.e. skip the stat-s that haven't published any value
during recent collection cycles.

parameters.name: dt
parameters.description:
Indicates that the requested stats are based on some dynamic threshold.
<b>Defaults to false which indicates that stats are not based on dynamic threshold.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description:
The ending date as a long value of the range of stats to return
Long value is number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC
NOTE: The ending date must not be less than the beginning date.
If not provided, current time as UTC milliseconds is used

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The Identifier of the resource object

parameters.name: intervalQuantifier
parameters.description: Number for the interval type

parameters.name: intervalType
parameters.description: Interval type requested by the user (e.g: Days, Weeks, Months etc.)

parameters.name: latestMaxSamples
parameters.description:
The maximum number of samples to return when querying latest.
When processing the get latest stats query if it is omitted a value of 1 is assumed.
A query for the latest samples is not compatible with specifying the RollUpType value.

parameters.name: metrics
parameters.description: Indicates whether specified statKey-s of query should be forcibly treated as metrics (does not include instanced stats)

parameters.name: resourceId
parameters.description: Array of Resource ids for which the stats should be fetched

parameters.name: rollUpType
parameters.description: Rollup Type requested by the user (e.g.: AVG, MIN, MAX etc.)

parameters.name: statKey
parameters.description: Array of stat keys for which the stats should be returned

parameters.name: wrapStatValues
parameters.description:
Indicates whether stat values should be wrapped for application/xml response content type.
This flag is false by default and not needed for application/json response.
If set to true "statValues" will be returned instead of "values" for all content types.

200.description: Object, containing a map of List of Stat objects keyed by each resource UUID

examples.application/xml:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<ops:stats-of-resources xmlns:ops="http://webservice.vmware.com/vRealizeOpsMgr/1.0/" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">

                <ops:rollUpType>NONE</ops:rollUpType>

            </ops:stat>

</ops:stats-of-resources>

The maximum number of samples to return when querying latest.

parameters.name: topN
parameters.description:
The number of results. Keep in mind if a grouping contains multiple items (eg:
grouped by resource, with 4 metrics for the grouping resource) then returning the group with
4 metrics counts as 4 topN entries. If there are not enough remaining open topN entries to
return an entire group within the topN then the entire group is not returned. *

Indicates whether stat values should be wrapped for application/xml response content type.
This flag is false by default and not needed for application/json response.
If set to true "statValues" will be returned instead of "values" for all content types.

get.summary: Look up all Symptoms in the system
get.description:
Optionally these Symptoms can be looked up for a specific set of Resources and/or 
can include Symptoms that are no longer active.
The list of Symptoms returned is a collection that supports pagination.

parameters.description: Boolean that determines whether the results should include inactive Symptoms

parameters.name: includeAlarmInfo
parameters.description: Boolean that controls the retrieval of alarm information of the symptom

parameters.name: page

parameters.name: pageSize

get.summary: Look up a list of task objects' statuses
get.description:
In general, to get the status of any long running operations, the operation 
must have been initiated through the VMware Aria Operations REST API.
This API endpoint returns the details of the long running tasks that were submitted via the API only.
Furthermore, the list of tasks that this API returns includes tasks for long running operations such 
as Adapter Installation, Describe etc.  This API does not return the tasks created when any 
Remediation Actions are executed in the system either via the UI or via the API.

parameters.name: taskId
parameters.description: The task ids

parameters.name: taskState
parameters.description: States of the tasks

examples.application/xml:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<ops:task-statuses xmlns:ops="http://webservice.vmware.com/vRealizeOpsMgr/1.0/" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
    <ops:task-status>
        <ops:taskId>5e380549-b5d9-4e4e-9e48-0cc32242958f</ops:taskId>
        <ops:statusMessage>Distributed Task Execution for ADAPTER_INSTALL</ops:statusMessage>
        <ops:taskState>RUNNING</ops:taskState>
        <ops:createdTime>0</ops:createdTime>
        <ops:lastUpdateTime>1740454580004</ops:lastUpdateTime>
        <ops:errorMessages/>
    </ops:task-status>
</ops:task-statuses>

get.summary: Look up a task status with the given identifier
get.description: In general, to get the status of any long running operations, the operation must have been initiated through the VMware Aria Operations REST API. This API returns the status of a specific task that was initiated via the REST API with the exception of tasks that get created when any Remediation Action is performed via the api/actions endpoint.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task

200.description: Task status with the specified identifier

examples.application/xml:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
