key.description: The StatKey for the dynamic threshold
The SuperMetric Id for the dynamic threshold

DTSM-condition.title: DTSM-condition
DTSM-condition.description: Dynamic Threshold on Super Metrics Condition

key.description: The StatKey for the condition

targetKey.description: A target StatKey to compare the values between two metrics.  Required for metric or property threshold type conditions

thresholdType.description: The type of threshold comparison for the right-hand side of the condition: static, metric or property.

value.description: The static value of the condition

valueType.description: Type of condition value: numeric or string. Type value also controls the type of comparison operators that are applicable

key.description: The super metric key

HTSM-condition.title: HTSM-condition
HTSM-condition.description: Hard Threshold numeric Condition on a super metric

name.description: The name of the metering object

childrenResourceKindFilters.description:
If matchResourceIdOnly is set to false, this set allows the system to further filter children
based on their Resource Kind keys. This filter is deprecated. Please use childrenResourceKindKeyFilters instead.

childrenResourceKindKeyFilters.description: Filter based on children resource kind keys.

matchResourceIdOnly.description: Deprecated, will be removed after couple of releases. Please use relationship instead. If set to true, the rule engine does not evaluate the resource's children. Default value is: false. NOTE: If set to true, childrenResourceKindKeyFilters has to be empty.

relationship.description:
Specifies whether the rule engine needs to evaluate only the resource itself, its direct children or all descendants. Acceptable values are: SELF, CHILD, DESCENDANT. Default value is: DESCENDANT.
NOTE: If set to SELF, childrenResourceKindKeyFilters has to be empty.

resourceId.description: Id of the resource that should be matched against the generated alert

ResourceFilter.title: ResourceFilter
ResourceFilter.description: Filter for resources. If matchResourceIdOnly is specified, alerts are selected if their resource ids match with the 'resourceId' specified in the filter. Otherwise, the system looks at all the resource's children. The possible set of children can be further filtered based on the childrenResourceKindKeyFilters.

ResourceKindFilter.title: ResourceKindFilter
ResourceKindFilter.description: Filter based on the resource kind

type.description: The resource selection type: propagate, unpropagate, or specific

ResourceSelection.title: ResourceSelection
ResourceSelection.description: A selection type and set of resource ids.

key.description: Search Criteria key

SearchCriteria.title: SearchCriteria
SearchCriteria.description: The key value pair for storing search criteria

key.description: The key of tag based metering object

value.description: The value of tag based metering object

fields.description: The action context fields defined for the action with data populated using the expression where defined

id.description: The ID of the action context

action-context.title: action-context
action-context.description: Represents an executable step within an action. It defines which method the step calls and what fields related to this step.

component.description: The display component appropriate for action context field

displayOrder.description: The order of this field within the list of all action context fields

expressionResults.description: The result of running the expression on each resource, this first resource will be the first value in the list and the second will be the second value, etc.

hidden.description: True if this action context field may be hidden from display

id.description: The ID of the action context field

input.description: True if user can change the populated value of this field, false otherwise

name.description: The name of the action context field

parameterKey.description: The parameter key on the method to which this action context field corresponds

action-context-field.title: action-context-field
action-context-field.description: Defines a field within the action context of an action. This field may be a display only parameter, and may have an expression that determines its value or the default one.

actionAdapterKindKey.description: The kind of the adapter that will execute the action

canRecommend.description: This field specifies whether the action can be used in recommendations. This is validated when an action is associated to a recommendation.

contextAdapterKindKey.description: The adapter kind of the context object that the action will be populated with. In other words, the kind of adapter that will be used when populating an action prior to execution. This may be different from the target resource, or the kind of the adapter that the action is executed against

contextIds.description: The ids for the available Action Contexts for this action. Action Contexts are used in multi-step actions, with each id denoting a step in the overall action. Most actions will only have a single step, and this field may be ignored for those.

contextResourceKindKey.description: The resource kind of the context object that the action will be populated with. In other words, the kind of resource that will be used when populating an action prior to execution. This may be different than the kind of resource that the action is executed against, or the target resource.

displayName.description: The localized name of the action

id.description: The id of the action

scheduleEnabled.description: This field specifies whether the action can be scheduled

contextId.description: An optional value naming the action step that will be executed

contextResourceId.description: The UUID list of resources that the action will be performed against

parameterGroups.description: The parameters that are used as inputs for the action being performed

action-execution.title: action-execution
action-execution.description: Contains describe instance data about performing an action.

id.description: The id of the action object

messages.description: The messages for the action result

action-object-status.title: action-object-status
action-object-status.description: Represents the task status and properties of an executed action

dataType.description: The data type of the method parameter

id.description: The id of the method parameter

isList.description: True if the parameter is a list of values, false if not

isRequired.description: True if the parameter is required, false otherwise

action-parameter.title: action-parameter
action-parameter.description: Represents the parameters that are needed when calling a method.

parameterValue.description: Contains the parameter values associated with this resource.

resourceId.description: The resourceId field contains the Resource Id of the object which the action is run against.

action-parameter-group.title: action-parameter-group
action-parameter-group.description: Contains the resource uuid and parameter values for a method.

contextResourceId.description: The UUID list of the resources that the population will be run against

action-population.title: action-population

capacity-allocation-settings.title: capacity-allocation-settings
capacity-allocation-settings.description:
Allocation Model differs to Demand Model as it does not consider Utilization. It is simply based on configured amount (e.g. 4 vCPU, 16 GB virtual RAM, 100 GB virtual Disk) that is allocated to VMs. As a result, Demand Model is still considered when Allocation is enabled.
Note: These settings will also apply to What-If Analysis, Committed Projects, and WLP calculations.

begin.description:
The beginning date as a long value of the range of stats to return
Value measures the number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC

end.description:
The ending date as a long value of the range of stats to return
long value is number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC

dt-stat-query.title: dt-stat-query
dt-stat-query.description: Object used to define search criteria for retrieving Stats Data as well as Dynamic Thresholds The query spec enforces that at least one Resource (Object) and at least one StatKey is specified. The begin and end values that are used to specify the time window are optional. If these are not specified the API returns 24 hours of Stats and DT data by default.

body.description: Email body. If those fields are not provided, the value of newAlertTemplate will be used while sending the notification.

managedExternally.description:
If set to true, this event shall persist across collection cycles until another event is pushed
to change the status. 
If set to false, this event will be cancelled during the next collection cycle if it is not pushed again

The start time for the event in UTC.
This time must be after >= 946684800000L, or January 1, 2000.  Default is 946684800000L.
Value is ignored for Change events.

The server inturn informs the adapters that monitor these resources to stop monitoring until specified otherwise.Each maintenance schedule has an id, key and schedule. Both id and key have to be unique within the system. While id is automatically assigned by the server, key must be specified by the user.

action.description: An optional recommended action to associate with the recommendation

id.description: The recommendation id. Must be null during creation (System generated identifier)

recommendation.title: recommendation
recommendation.description:
The Recommendation encapsulates information and possible action needed to resolve a problem in the system. The Recommendation optionally includes a RecommendedAction.

In other words, a recommendation may have textual data and no associated action or it can have both. The Recommendation is uniquely identified by an identifier which is generated by the system during its creation.

actionAdapterKindId.description:
The Adapter Kind that defined this Recommended Action
An example could be the Out-of-the-box Remediation Adapter Kind ID

targetAdapterKindId.description:
The Adapter Kind for which this Recommended Action is applicable.
An example could be the Out-of-the-box VC Adapter Kind ID viz. "VMWARE"

targetMethod.description:
Name of the remediation action that needs to be performed on the resource
An example could be a few of the VM lifecycle operations viz. "shutdown", "reset" etc.

targetResourceKindId.description: Resource Kind of the Adapter Kind targetAdapterKindId on which this Recommended Action is applicable. For certain recommended actions, this can be null. The system supports a scenario where the Recommended Action is only associated with targetAdapterKindId only. An example could be the Out-of-the-box VC Resource Kind ID viz. "VirtualMachine"

recommended-action.title: recommended-action
recommended-action.description: Identifies an action the system may take to solve a problem.

The following keys can be used for payload construction and should be prefixed by $ : CREATE_TIME, UPDATE_TIME, CANCEL_TIME, ALERT_ID, ALERT_STATUS, ALERT_DEFINITION, ALERT_DEFINITION_DESCRIPTION, ALERT_RECOMMENDATIONS, RESOURCE_NAME, RESOURCE_KIND, RESOURCE_ID, ADAPTER_KIND, RESOURCE_KIND_TYPE, ALERT_IMPACT, CONTROL_STATE, ALERT_CRITICALITY, ALERT_TYPE, ALERT_SUBTYPE, OBJECT_HEALTH_STATE, OBJECT_RISK_STATE, OBJECT_EFFICIENCY_STATE, SYMPTOMS, ADAPTER_INSTANCE, LINK_TO_ALERT

badges.description: The various major and minor badges and their values for a Resource. If certain badges are not present in the list then either those badges are not applicable to this resource or the calculation of those badges has been disabled for this resource.

creationTime.description: Time the Resource was created in the system. This is a 'read-only' property and is system generated.The server ignores any changes to this field when trying to update a resource.

credentialInstanceId.description: Credential instance identifier assigned to this Resource, applicable only for adapter instances.

dtEnabled.description: DT calculation enabled or not. By default DT calculation for a resource is enabled (during its creation).

identifier.description: Identifier of the Resource (typically a UUID).

monitoringInterval.description: Minutes part of the monitoring Interval of the resource, applicable only for adapter instances.

monitoringIntervalSeconds.description: Seconds part of the monitoring Interval of the resource, applicable only for adapter instances.

resourceHealth.description: Health of the Resource. This is a 'read-only' property and its value is computed by the system. The server ignores any changes to this field when trying to update a resource.

resourceHealthValue.description: Resource Health Score. This is a 'read-only' property and its value is computed by the system. The server ignores any changes to this field when trying to update a resource.

resourceStatusStates.description: The resource status and resource state for this resource as reported by one or more adapter instances. The server ignores any changes to this field when trying to update a resource.

None null value specifies to include related resource ids of given relationship type in resource result.

Array of {@link UUID} that identify Maintenance Schedules.
Since vROps 6.1.0 release onwards, we don't support search
and look up of Resources using Maintenance Schedules' identifiers.

name.description: Array of resource names to query for. NOTE: Currently, only single element supported

parentId.description: Array of UUID of object that are the parent resource in a parent child relationship

propertyConditions.description: Property conditions query to be used for filtering. NOTE: If this filter is specified only the resources that have resource status 'DATA_RECEIVING' will be returned.

propertyName.description: Name of property. Query only supports filtering for a single property.

propertyValue.description: Value of property. Omitting the property value will check for existence of the property name on the resource. NOTE: Use 'propertyConditions' to specify lookup of Resource using multiple properties.

recentlyAdded.description: Return resources created after the specified value. Value is the number of seconds since Midnight January 1, 1970 GMT.

regex.description: Array of resource names in java regex format. NOTE: regex and name are mutually exclusive. If both are specified, name is given preference.

resourceState.description: Array of resource states. NOTE, the following states are applicable only for adapter instances: STOPPED, STARTING, STOPPING, UPDATING, FAILED, REMOVING

resourceStatus.description: Array of resource data collection statuses. NOTE, the following statuses are applicable only for adapter instances: ERROR, DOWN, COLLECTOR_DOWN. The statuses OLD_DATA_RECEIVING, NO_PARENT_MONITORING and UNKNOWN are deprecated.

resourceTag.description: Property used for tag filtering. NOTE: If specified, only the resources with the tags will be returned.

statConditions.description: Stat conditions query to be used for filtering. NOTE: If this filter is specified only the resources that have resource status 'DATA_RECEIVING' will be returned.

statKey.description: Name of resource StatKey to validate value is within a range. Use with statKeyLowerBound, statKeyUpperBound and statKeyInclusive to create comparison conditions NOTE: Use 'statConditions' to specify lookup of Resource using multiple stat keys.

statKeyInclusive.description: Filtering by statKey values is inclusive or exclusive of boundary values.  Defaults to true

statKeyLowerBound.description: StatKey value matching range lower bound

statKeyUpperBound.description: StatKey value matching range upper bound

Class associates a single Stat with a ResourceId. The class is backed by the Stat argument
passed, so changes to this class will effect the Stat object data.

allowAllObjects.description: If true then ignore traversal specifications and allow all objects

role-permission.title: role-permission
role-permission.description: Represents role based permissions to objects.  The role's privileges will apply to all of the objects identified by the traversal specification. Optionally permission can be flagged to allow all objects ignoring traversal specifications.

dayOfTheMonth.description:
Deprecated, will be removed after couple of releases.
Day of the month on which the job should be triggered. Must be specified only when scheduleType = MONTHLY. Mutually exclusive with daysOfTheMonth and weeksOfTheMonth.

daysOfTheMonth.description: The list of the days of the month on which the job should be triggered. Applicable values are {1,2,...,31,LAST}. Must be specified only when scheduleType = MONTHLY. Mutually exclusive with dayOfTheMonth and weeksOfTheMonth.

daysOfTheWeek.description:
Days of the week on which the job should be triggered. Must be specified only when scheduleType = WEEKLY or scheduleType = MONTHLY.
When scheduleType = MONTHLY this parameter is mutually exclusive with dayOfTheMonth and daysOfTheMonth, should be specified together with daysOfTheWeek.

duration.description: Duration of the schedule in minutes.

expirationDate.description: The expiration date of the schedule. Should be in format MM/DD/YYYY. Mutually exclusive with expireRuns and either of them should be always defined when scheduleType != ONCE.

expireRuns.description: The number of run after which the schedule should expire. Mutually exclusive with expirationDate and either of them should be always defined when scheduleType != ONCE.

hour.description: The beginning hour of the schedule.

minuteOfTheHour.description: The beginning minutes of the schedule.

month.description:
Deprecated, will be removed after couple of releases.
Month of the year on which the job should be triggered. Must be specified only when scheduleType = MONTHLY. Mutually exclusive with months.

months.description: Months of the year on which the job should be triggered. Must be specified only when scheduleType = MONTHLY. Mutually exclusive with month.

recurrence.description:
Configures how the schedule is repeated within the provided interval, e.g. if scheduleType = DAILY then setting recurrence = 2 would trigger the job every 2 days.
Applicable only when scheduleType = DAILY or scheduleType = WEEKLY.

scheduleType.description: Type of the schedule. NOTE: Currently schedule type 'YEARLY' is not supported.

startDate.description: Start date for the schedule. Should be in format MM/DD/YYYY and if not specified current date is used.

timeZone.description:
Time Zone of the schedule.
If not provided, defaults to the time of the VMware Aria Operations server.

weeksOfTheMonth.description: The list of the week indices of the month on which the job should be triggered. Must be specified only when scheduleType = MONTHLY. Mutually exclusive with dayOfTheMonth and daysOfTheMonth, should be specified together with daysOfTheWeek.

schedule.title: schedule
schedule.description: Schedule represents the meta information required by the server to set resources in maintenance mode at the right interval/time. To construct specific schedules, please see some of the static helper utilities in this class.

data.description: The numeric data that is being posted

values.description: The string values that are being posted

Represents the Stat Content posted by the user.
The data posted by the user can be numeric data or string data.
However both types of the data cannot be sent together.

stat-contents.description: Represents the Stat Contents posted by the user

key.description: The stat key

stat-key.description: Unique representation of a metric-key/stat stored and exposed by the stats platform

stat-keys.title: stat-keys
stat-keys.description: Container for a List of StatKey values

doubleValue.description: Double value to which we need to compare to

key.description: The name of the StatKey or Property to which the condition applies

operator.description:
Comparison operator to use.
Default value is EXISTS, i.e. checks the existence of stat or property.

stringValue.description: String value to which we need to compare to

stat-or-property-condition.title: stat-or-property-condition
stat-or-property-condition.description: Model that represents a Property Condition

conditions.description: Array of condition to be used for filtering

conjunctionOperator.description:
Indicates the conjunction of the filtering criteria
Either all of the filtering criteria apply together (AND operation) or any of the filtering criteria could be applied (OR operation)
Defaults to OR.

stat-or-property-condition-query.title: stat-or-property-condition-query
stat-or-property-condition-query.description: Object used to define filtering criteria based on multiple stats/properties with possibility to specify the conjunction operator

begin.description:
The beginning date as a long value of the range of stats to return
Value measures the number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC
NOTE: If not provided, 24 hour rearward of ending date is used

currentOnly.description:
Indicates whether to report only "current" stat values, i.e. skip the stat-s that haven't published any value
during recent collection cycles.

dt.description:
Indicates that the requested stats are based on some dynamic threshold.
<b>Defaults to false which indicates that stats are not based on dynamic threshold.

end.description:
The ending date as a long value of the range of stats to return
Long value is number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC
NOTE: The ending date must not be less than the beginning date.
If not provided, current time as UTC milliseconds is used

intervalType.description: Interval type requested by the user (e.g: Days, Weeks, Months etc.)

latestMaxSamples.description:
The maximum number of samples to return when querying latest.
When processing the get latest stats query if it is omitted a value of 1 is assumed.
A query for the latest samples is not compatible with specifying the RollUpType value.

metrics.description: Indicates whether specified statKey-s of query should be forcibly treated as metrics (does not include instanced stats)

resourceId.description: Array of Resource ids for which the stats should be fetched

rollUpType.description: Rollup Type requested by the user (e.g.: AVG, MIN, MAX etc.)

statKey.description: Array of stat keys for which the stats should be returned

wrapStatValues.description:
Indicates whether stat values should be wrapped for application/xml response content type.
This flag is false by default and not needed for application/json response.
If set to true "statValues" will be returned instead of "values" for all content types.

stat-query.title: stat-query
stat-query.description:
Object used to request stats(metrics) on a collection of resources.
Defines search criteria as well as expected data set.

statValues.description:
The string data wrapped.
This is equivalent to the "values" field, with the sole difference of having values wrapped in separate elements when content type is application/xml.

timestamps.description: Time stamps at which data is available

So, backward compatibility of the content of the message format is not guaranteed.

cancelTimeUTC.description: Time when the symptom was canceled

faultDevices.description: Additional information of the faulted devices.

id.description: The ID which identifies the Symptom

kpi.description: True, if the symptom is a KPI, false otherwise

message.description:
The message associated with a symptom.
This is usually applicable for Event based Symptoms

resourceId.description: The ID of the resource on which the Symptom was generated

symptomDefinitionId.description: The Symptom Definition describing the violated rule for this Symptom

updateTimeUTC.description: Last updated time of the symptom

id.description: The identifier for the SymptomDefinition. Must be null during create.

realtimeMonitoringEnabled.description: Indicates whether real-time monitoring is enabled for the symptom or not. (This field is only visible in SaaS)

resourceKindKey.description: The resource kind identifier for the SymptomDefinition

state.description: The symptom state associated with this symptom definition

waitCycles.description: The number of consecutive cycles to wait when a symptom state is true before a symptom is triggered

symptom-definition.description: A Symptom Definition defines conditions and properties which define when an alarm is triggered

Include Symptoms that are currently Active.
By default, only active Symptoms are included in the result

Indicates the composition of the filtering criteria.
Either all of the filtering criteria apply together (AND operation) or any of the filtering criteria could be applied (OR operation) NOTE: OR is currently not supported.

includeAlarmInfo.description: Boolean that controls the retrieval of alarm information of the symptom

includeChildrenResources.description: Whether to include Symptoms of all the children of resources identified by resourceIds

resource-query.description: Return alarms associated with resources matching query criteria

statKey.description: Return Symptoms that have been generated because of violations on the Stat Keys specified

symptomDefinitionId.description: Return Symptoms that have the specified list of Symptom Definitions

symptom-query.title: symptom-query
symptom-query.description: Query for Symptoms using various criteria. Composition of filtering criteria controlled via the compositeOperator property. Pagination of the Symptoms that are returned can be controlled via the PageInfo object. Sorting of the Symptoms is specified via the SymptomField object and the SortOrder object controls the order in which the Symptoms are sorted. If a sort field is not specified but pagination is requested the Symptoms will be sorted by the alarmId property.

traversal-spec.description: Represents traversal specs. These are templates in the system using which admins can assign specific set of resources to their users.

adapterKind.description: The root Adapter kind of the Traversal Specification. Together with resourceKind and name these values uniquely identify the traversal specification used by this instance.

includedAdapterKinds.description: The adapter kinds that apply to this traversal specification instance. Only applicable for traversal specification templates with a filter type of ADAPTER_ASSOCIATION. If this is present, then all adapter instances of this kind are selected as part of the hierarchy.

name.description: The name of the Traversal Specification. Together with adapterKind and resourceKind these values uniquely identify a traversal specification used by this instance.

resourceSelection.description: List of root resource id selections

selectAllResources.description: When flag is true system will ignore resource selections and include all resources in the tree defined by the traversal specification templat.

traversal-spec-instance.description: Represents traversal spec type. This can be used by users and user groups in a permission objects.

emailAddress.description: The email address of the current user

externalId.description: External ID of vIDB user group. This field is only used in vIDB user group import flow. It will not be populated for any other scenarios. Please note, this field may be removed in future.

id.description:
The identifier of this group.(unique)

Note: Required when updating or deleting the user group.

role-permissions.description: The list of role permissions assigned to this group. May be null. Replaces and takes precedence over roleNames.

roleNames.description: (Deprecated) List of role names assigned to the user group.  May be null.

userIds.description: The list of users who are members of this group.

displayName.description: A role name suitable for display.

system-created.description: True if this role was created by the system

humanlyReadableReleaseDate.description: The application release date as a humanly readable string

major.description: Major version of the application. This field is bumped up when there is a complete change of all available API(s) in the system. API(s) in two different major versions are incompatible with each other.

minor.description: Minor version of the application. This field is bumped up for releases that introduce new features, model object and end point enhancements.

minorMinor.description: Minor minor version of the application. This field is bumped up for releases that are only bugfixes(no new features)

releaseName.description: Name of the release that published this version

releasedDate.description: The date when was an application server with this version has been released

version.title: version
version.description: Represents the Product and API version information of the VMware Aria Operations Suite

id.description: id

webhook-template.title: webhook-template

canceledAlertRequestConfig.description: Canceled Webhook template request config. If it is not provided the value of newAlertTemplate will be used while sending the alert.

updatedAlertRequestConfig.description: Updated Webhook template request config. If it is not provided the value of newAlertTemplate will be used while sending the alert.

allOf.title: webhook-template
allOf.description: Model that represents a webhook template. Either both of the updatedAlertRequestConfig and canceledAlertRequestConfig fields should be provided or neither of them. If those fields are not provided, the value of newAlertRequestConfig will be used while sending the notification.

webhook-template.description: Model that represents a webhook template. Either both of the updatedAlertRequestConfig and canceledAlertRequestConfig fields should be provided or neither of them. If those fields are not provided, the value of newAlertRequestConfig will be used while sending the notification.

endTime.description: End time for history. If not specified, the current time is used.

resourceIds.description:
Currently only one Resource Id can be provided. Support for multiple ids is not available.
The id can belong to a Datacenter, CustomDatacenter or a CloudZone for which Workload Rebalance has been performed.
If not specified, all such resources are taken into consideration.

startTime.description: Start time for history. If not specified, the day prior to the endTime is used.

wlp-history-query.title: wlp-history-query
wlp-history-query.description: Represents criteria of wlp history query.

automationEnabled.description: Specifies whether optimization automation enabled or not

inherited.description: Whether policy settings are inherited or not

policyId.description: Policy id where policy settings is defined. This field is not supported in Capacity settings and Criticality thresholds.

clusterExclusionEnabled.description: Turn off exclusion settings for Cluster. By default 'false'.

excludedClusterTagGroups.description: Collection of cluster excluded tag groups

placementSettingsEnabled.description: Turn off placement settings. Criteria defined in 'tagGroups' will no longer be considered for VM placement. By default 'true'.

taggingScope.description: Specifies workload placement scope, i.e. cluster/host based.

externalDocs.description: The old, deprecated Documentation can be found here.
